description: The CodeBoarding platform orchestrates repository interaction, static analysis, data management, LLM‑driven agents, and reporting. The Application Orchestration component initiates change detection, runs the Static Analysis Engine, stores results in Analysis Data Management, and coordinates agents. Agents obtain processed analysis data, request prompts and configurations from the LLM Prompt & Configuration Management component, and use specialized tools to interact with the codebase. Finally, reporting generates diagrams, health diagnostics, and other output formats for architectural understanding and monitoring.

components.name: LLM Prompt & Configuration Management
components.description: This component is responsible for the dynamic generation, management, and configuration of prompts for various Large Language Models (LLMs) used throughout the system. It also handles the configuration and initialization of the LLMs themselves, including API key management.

components.name: Prompt Factory Interface
components.description: Defines the abstract contract for creating various types of LLM prompts, ensuring a standardized and extensible approach aligned with the Abstract Factory pattern.

components.name: Prompt Factory Interface
components.description: Defines the abstract contract for creating various types of LLM prompts, ensuring a standardized and extensible approach aligned with the Abstract Factory pattern. It decouples client code from concrete prompt factories and supports easy addition of new prompt types.

components.name: Generic Prompt Factory
components.description: Concrete implementation of the Prompt Factory Interface providing a general mechanism for constructing LLM prompts, serving as a default factory when no specific LLM factory is required.

components.name: Generic Prompt Factory
components.description: Concrete implementation of a prompt factory interface that builds LLM prompts from various inputs, serving as the default fallback mechanism for prompt generation within the agents.prompts subsystem.

components.name: Gemini Prompt Factory
components.description: Specialized concrete factory implementing the Prompt Factory Interface for generating prompts optimized for the Gemini family of LLMs.

components.name: Gemini Prompt Factory
components.description: A concrete factory implementation that produces prompts tailored for the Gemini family of LLMs, adhering to the Prompt Factory Interface.

components.name: LLM Configuration Manager
components.description: Responsible for loading, storing, and providing configuration details for various LLMs, including API keys and model‑specific settings.

components.name: LLM Configuration Manager
components.description: Responsible for loading, storing, and providing configuration details for various Large Language Models (LLMs), including API keys and model-specific settings. Acts as a central repository ensuring consistent access and management of sensitive and operational parameters.

components.name: Agent Core & Tooling
components.description: This component encapsulates the core logic of the CodeBoarding agents and the specialized tools they use to interact with the codebase and its analysis results. It defines the structured response formats for agent outputs and acts as the central intelligence and orchestration unit.

components.name: CodeBoardingAgent
components.description: Central intelligence and orchestration unit that drives analysis, makes decisions, and synthesizes findings using various tools.

components.name: Agent Orchestrator
components.description: Central control unit embodied by the CodeBoardingAgent class. It interprets high‑level goals, manages workflow, and orchestrates internal components, handling overall control flow, task decomposition, decision‑making, and coordination.

components.name: Reasoning Module
components.description: Analytical component that processes contextual information, generates strategic plans, and determines the next best action based on the current state and objectives. It leverages language models and prompt engineering for intelligent decision‑making.

components.name: Tool Executor
components.description: Manages selection, invocation, and execution of external tools or functions, acting as the interface between the agent's internal logic and its available toolset.

components.name: Context Manager
components.description: Maintains and provides access to the agent's operational context, including conversational history, intermediate results, and relevant state information, ensuring coherent understanding of ongoing tasks.

components.name: Input/Output Handler
components.description: Facilitates communication between the CodeBoardingAgent and external entities, handling reception of initial requests and delivery of final or intermediate responses.

components_relations.relation: provides historical and current context to

components.name: FileContentTool
components.description: Utility that enables the agent to retrieve and read the content of specific files within the project's codebase.

components.name: FileContentTool
components.description: Primary interface for agents to access and read the content of files within the project's codebase. It encapsulates the logic for handling file read requests and interacting with the underlying file system.

components.name: Agent
components.description: Intelligent entity that utilizes various tools, including FileContentTool, to perform tasks. It initiates requests for file content as part of its operational workflow.

components.name: File System Access
components.description: Foundational component responsible for low‑level operations of interacting directly with the file system to retrieve file data. It provides the actual mechanism for reading file contents.

components.name: CFGTool
components.description: Utility that provides the agent with the capability to analyze and extract information from Control Flow Graphs of the codebase.

components.name: CFGTool
components.description: Utility for analyzing and extracting information from Control Flow Graphs (CFGs) of the codebase.

components.name: AnalysisInsights
components.description: Standardized data structure and format for the analytical findings, conclusions, and recommendations produced by the agent.

components.name: AnalysisInsights
components.description: Provides a standardized data structure and format for encapsulating analytical findings, conclusions, and recommendations generated by an agent, ensuring consistency across the system.

components.name: Static Analysis Engine
components.description: This component provides the foundational capabilities for performing static analysis on various programming languages, primarily through Language Server Protocol (LSP) clients and language-specific configurations. It handles communication with LSP servers to extract code information.

components.name: LSPClient
components.description: Abstract base class for all LSP client implementations, defining the generic interface and common functionalities required to establish and maintain communication with any LSP server.

components.name: LSPClient
components.description: Abstract base class for all LSP client implementations, defining the generic interface and common functionalities required to establish and maintain communication with any LSP server.

components.name: TypeScriptClient
components.description: Concrete implementation of LSPClient specifically tailored to interact with TypeScript Language Servers, handling serialization, deserialization, and language‑specific initialization/shutdown.

components.name: JavaLSPClient
components.description: Concrete LSP client implementation for Java language servers, extending LSPClient to handle Java-specific LSP messages, capabilities, and configurations.

components.name: JavaLSPClient
components.description: Concrete LSP client implementation for Java language servers, extending LSPClient to handle Java-specific LSP messages, capabilities, and configurations.

components.name: LSPClient
components.description: Abstract base class defining common functionalities for any LSP client, handling generic LSP communication, request/response IDs, and the core LSP lifecycle.

components.name: LanguageServerProcessManager
components.description: Manages the lifecycle of the external language server process, including start, health monitoring, and graceful shutdown, abstracting OS‑specific details.

components.name: LSPProtocolHandler
components.description: Handles low‑level LSP communication details, including JSON‑RPC serialization/deserialization and transport layer framing with content‑length headers.

components.name: ProgrammingLanguage
components.description: Encapsulates definitions and configurations for supported programming languages, providing metadata such as file extensions, syntax rules, and LSP server initiation details.

components.name: ProgrammingLanguage
components.description: Encapsulates definitions and configurations for supported programming languages, providing metadata such as file extensions, syntax rules, and LSP server initiation details. Acts as a central registry or configuration store for language-specific information within the static analysis framework.

components.name: JavaConfigScanner
components.description: Scans Java projects to identify and extract configuration details (e.g., build systems, project structure) needed by JavaLSPClient for accurate, context‑aware static analysis.

components.name: UserProvisioningService
components.description: Handles user account creation, registration, profile management, and initiates the provisioning of a coding environment for new users. It acts as the entry point for user onboarding.

components.name: EnvironmentOrchestrator
components.description: Manages the lifecycle of isolated coding environments (containers/VMs). It creates, scales, monitors, and tears down environments, mounts user code, and forwards execution requests.

components.name: CodeExecutionEngine
components.description: Securely runs user-submitted code within a provisioned environment, capturing output and resource usage. It focuses on the safe and controlled execution of user code.

components.name: ChallengeManagementService
components.description: Stores and retrieves coding challenges, test cases, and reference solutions. It serves as the content repository for all challenge-related data.

components.name: CollaborationService
components.description: Enables real-time multi-user editing, synchronizing changes and requesting shared environments. It facilitates interactive coding experiences.

components.name: AssessmentService
components.description: Evaluates submitted code against challenge test cases, producing feedback, performance metrics, and hints. It is responsible for grading and progress tracking.

components.name: CodeStorageService
components.description: Provides persistent storage for user code, project files, and version history. It acts as the central repository for all code assets.

components.name: JavaConfigScanner
components.description: Scans Java projects to identify and extract configuration details (e.g., build systems, project structure) needed by JavaLSPClient for accurate, context‑aware static analysis.

components.name: Analysis Data Management
components.description: This component is responsible for processing, storing, caching, and analyzing the results generated by the static analysis engine. It defines data structures for call graphs, manages a central repository for analysis results, and handles caching and cluster change analysis.

components.name: CallGraph
components.description: Defines the data structures and methods for representing the call graph generated by the static analysis engine, encapsulating nodes (functions, methods) and edges (calls) that illustrate execution flow.

components.name: CallGraph
components.description: Defines the data structures and methods for representing the call graph generated by the static analysis engine, encapsulating nodes (functions, methods) and edges (calls) that illustrate execution flow. It serves as the core data model for static analysis results related to function calls.

components.name: AnalysisResult
components.description: Serves as the central repository for all static analysis outcomes, aggregating processed results, including references to CallGraph instances and other relevant metrics.

components.name: AnalysisResult
components.description: Serves as the central repository for all static analysis outcomes, aggregating processed results, including references to CallGraph instances and other relevant metrics. It acts as a data container for the final output of the static analysis process.

components.name: AnalysisCache
components.description: Optimizes performance by caching previously computed analysis results, managing storage and retrieval of AnalysisResult objects to prevent redundant computations.

components.name: AnalysisCache
components.description: Optimizes performance by caching previously computed analysis results, managing storage and retrieval of `AnalysisResult` objects to prevent redundant computations. It serves as a persistent store for analysis outcomes, ensuring that the same analysis is not re‑computed unnecessarily.

components.name: ClusterChangeAnalyzer
components.description: Specializes in detecting and analyzing changes within code clusters based on stored AnalysisResult data, comparing different versions to identify significant structural or behavioral shifts.

components.name: ClusterChangeAnalyzer
components.description: Specializes in detecting and analyzing changes within code clusters based on stored AnalysisResult data, comparing different versions to identify significant structural or behavioral shifts.

components.name: Repository Change Detection
components.description: This component is solely focused on detecting and categorizing changes within a Git repository, providing a structured representation of modifications (added, modified, deleted, renamed files) for further analysis.

components.name: ChangeDetector
components.description: Active agent that interacts with the Git repository to detect file changes (added, modified, deleted, renamed), parses Git output, and populates a ChangeSet with structured results.

components.name: ChangeDetector
components.description: Core component responsible for orchestrating detection of file changes within a Git repository. Executes Git commands, parses output, and populates a structured ChangeSet.

components.name: ChangeSet
components.description: Data structure that holds the categorized results of change detection, providing accessors for added, modified, deleted, and renamed files, and serving as an immutable DTO.

components.name: ChangeSet
components.description: An immutable DTO that stores and categorizes the results of a change‑detection operation (added, modified, deleted, renamed files). It provides read‑only accessors for each category and serves as the standardized output of the change‑detection process.

components_relations.dst_name: Downstream components (e.g., build systems, deployment pipelines, reporting tools)

components.name: Application Orchestration & Reporting
components.description: This comprehensive component manages the overall execution flow of the CodeBoarding application. It includes main entry points, job management, health checks, monitoring of operations, and generating various output formats for documentation and visualization. It also handles initial repository setup like cloning and ignore file management.

components.name: Application Orchestrator
components.description: Serves as the main entry point for the CodeBoarding application, managing the overall execution flow and coordinating stages from repository setup to analysis, monitoring, and report generation.

components.name: Application Orchestrator
components.description: Serves as the main entry point for the CodeBoarding application, managing the overall execution flow and coordinating stages from repository setup to analysis, monitoring, and report generation.

components.name: Diagram Generator
components.description: Transforms analysis results into visual diagrams, processing structured data for rendering by specific output generators.

components.name: DiagramGenerator
components.description: Processes structured analysis results and prepares data for rendering as visual diagrams.

components.name: HTML Output Generator
components.description: Generates HTML format output, rendering processed data into web-viewable reports or visualizations.

components.name: HTML Output Generator
components.description: Responsible for generating HTML output from processed data, rendering it into web-viewable reports or visualizations.

components.name: Monitoring Callback Handler
components.description: Monitors operational aspects such as LLM usage, providing callback mechanisms to capture and process runtime metrics and events.

components.name: LLMUsageCallback
components.description: A callback handler that monitors and captures operational metrics related to LLM usage, processing raw event data into structured metrics for storage and analysis.

components.name: Health Diagnostics
components.description: Performs diagnostic checks to assess codebase health and quality, e.g., identifying unused code.

components.name: UnusedCodeDiagnostics
components.description: Orchestrates and executes diagnostic checks to identify unreferenced or unused code elements across the project's codebase. It drives the analysis process, aggregates findings, and prepares them for reporting.

components.name: CodebaseAnalyzer
components.description: Parses the project's source code, builds an Abstract Syntax Tree (AST) and/or symbol table or call graph, and provides a structured representation of the code for analysis by diagnostic components.

components.name: DiagnosticReporter
components.description: Formats and presents the diagnostic findings generated by UnusedCodeDiagnostics. It can output reports to the console, generate structured data (e.g., JSON), or integrate with other reporting dashboards.

components_relations.relation: Triggers static code analysis for a given repository.
Retrieves processed analysis data for final reporting and diagram generation.
Orchestrates agent execution and receives analysis insights.
Provides raw static analysis data for processing and storage.
Supplies processed analysis results (e.g., CFGs, call graphs) to the agents.
Requests LLM prompts and configurations for agent tasks.
Provides configured LLMs and generated prompts to the agents.
Accesses repository change information via its specialized tools.
